When was the National Federation of State Cooperative Banks (NAFSCOB) established?
Where is the headquarters of NAFSCOB located?
What was the original name of NAFSCOB before it changed in 1978?
options: All India State Co-operative Bank Federation
correctAnswer: All India State Co-operative Bank Federation

questionText: Who proposed the idea of setting up a federation of State Cooperative Banks (SCBs) in India?
What is the main aim of NAFSCOB?
options: To regulate the interest rates in the banking sector
To safeguard the interests of State Co-operative Banks (SCBs) in India
correctAnswer: To safeguard the interests of State Co-operative Banks (SCBs) in India

questionText: What role does NAFSCOB serve in the interbank claims of the co-operative sector?
What is the function of the All India Mutual Arrangement Scheme (AIMAS)?
options: To facilitate the drawing of demand drafts, transfer of money, and collection of bills and cheques
To monitor interest rates for co-operative banks
To provide loans to co-operative banks
correctAnswer: To facilitate the drawing of demand drafts, transfer of money, and collection of bills and cheques

What is the main purpose of the National Co-operative Bank of India (NCBI)?
options: To promote private investment in co-operative banks
To act as the equaliser between higher and lower investment banks
correctAnswer: To act as the equaliser between higher and lower investment banks
